page.title: 12GOVERNMENT: PARISH COUNCIL
page.content: SOMERSHAM HAS AN ACTIVE PARISH COUNCIL. A RECENT AGM DISCUSSED THE FOLLOWING MAJOR ITEMS: THE DRAINAGE OF THE PLAYING FIELD; THE CONSTRUCTION OF A NEW FOOTPATH; THE DISCUSSIONS WITH OTHER PARISHES REGARDING ROAD IMPROVEMENTS ON THE B 1050 CAMBRIDGE ROAD; THE COMMISSIONING OF 1000 FIRST DAY COVERS BY THE PARISH COUNCIL, PRIMARY SCHOOL CHILDREN EACH BEING PRESENTED WITH ONE. PRESSURE HAS ALSO MOUNTED OVER THE YEAR TO STOP THE SALE OF THE DISUSED RAILWAY TRACK BY THE COUNTY COUNCIL. THE LINE IS EXTENSIVELY USED AS A LEISURE AREA. HOWEVER, THE SALE TO A GRAVEL EXTRACTION COMPANY SEEMS LIKELY, BUT WITH THE PROMISE OF A BRIDLEWAY REMAINING. A VILLAGE CAR PARK AND NEW DOCTOR'S SURGERY ARE TO BUILT ON A PIECE OF LAND THAT HAS BEEN SOLD TO THE (CONT.)
